bug.summary: Empty specs accepted by matcher.add_pattern, but cause error
bug.description:
From Issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/429>#429</denchmark-link> : import spacy import spacy.matcher
nlp = spacy.load('en', parser=False, entity=False) matcher = spacy.matcher.Matcher(nlp.vocab) content = u'''a b; c''' matcher.add(entity_key='1', label='TEST', attrs={}, specs=[[]]) matcher(nlp(content)) ->
Traceback (most recent call last): File "word2vec/matcher_bla.py", line 8, in <module> matcher(nlp(content)) File "spacy/matcher.pyx", line 315, in spacy.matcher.Matcher.__call__ (spacy/matcher.cpp:8519) Exception: Error selecting action in matcher
Caused by empty specs. While I understand that this is a mistake in my data it's better to check this when entity is being added.
